cleaned_text: Trial](https://sciencebasedmedicine.org/pledge/) Tag: complementary and alternative medicine [](https://sciencebasedmedicine.org/evidence-based-medicine-vs-basic-science-in-medical-school/) [Evidence-based medicine vs. basic science in medical school](https://sciencebasedmedicine.org/evidence-based-medicine-vs-basic-science-in-medical-school/) Last week Dr. Vinay Prasad wrote a Substack arguing that medical students should learn the principles of evidence-based medicine before basic science.This is a recipe for amplifying the main flaw in EBM that science-based medicine was meant to correct, and Dr. Prasad's arguments would have been right at home on an integrative medicine blog. [Note ADDENDUM.] [David Gorski](https://sciencebasedmedicine.org/author/david-gorski/)/ May 22, 2023 [](https://sciencebasedmedicine.org/after-15-years-of-sbm-lessons-learned-and-what-the-future-holds/) [After 15 years of SBM: Lessons learned and what the future holds](https://sciencebasedmedicine.org/after-15-years-of-sbm-lessons-learned-and-what-the-future-holds/) Last week, Dr. Novella discussed what SBM has accomplished over the last 15 years. I'm going to discuss lessons learned, what has changed, and remaining huge challenges. Unfortunately, after the pandemic, our position in 2022 reminds me even more than ever of Aragorn at the Black Gate of Mordor, but that does not mean things are hopeless. [David Gorski](https://sciencebasedmedicine.org/author/david-gorski/)/ December 26, 2022 [](https://sciencebasedmedicine.org/why-its-important-to-debunk-shivambu/) [Why It's Worthwhile to Debunk Shivambu](https://sciencebasedmedicine.org/why-its-important-to-debunk-shivambu/) Richard Feynman famously said, "The first principle is that you must not fool yourself—and you are the easiest person to fool". This is the most important lesson skepticism has to offer. [Jonathan Howard](https://sciencebasedmedicine.org/author/jonathanhoward/)/ December 17, 2021 [](https://sciencebasedmedicine.org/nccih-strategic-plan-2021%e2%81%a0-%e2%81%a02025-meet-the-new-plan-same-as-the-old-plan/) [NCCIH Strategic Plan 2021-2025: Meet the new plan, same as the old plan...?](https://sciencebasedmedicine.org/nccih-strategic-plan-2021%e2%81%a0-%e2%81%a02025-meet-the-new-plan-same-as-the-old-plan/) The National Center for Complementary and Integrative Health recently released its latest 5 year strategic plan. It's basically the same as the last strategic plan, but with one new addition. It's not really a new addition, but it signals a resurrection of an old trope about "integrating" quackery with science-based medicine. [David Gorski](https://sciencebasedmedicine.org/author/david-gorski/)/ 2021 [](https://sciencebasedmedicine.org/the-risks-associated-with-alternative-medicine/) [The risks associated with alternative medicine](https://sciencebasedmedicine.org/the-risks-associated-with-alternative-medicine/) In a new paper, the types and severity of harms from different types of alternative medicine are described. [Scott Gavura](https://sciencebasedmedicine.org/author/scottg416/)/ June 24, 2021 [](https://sciencebasedmedicine.org/adverse-events-linked-to-pediatric-alternative-medicine-in-the-netherlands/) [Adverse Events Linked to Pediatric "Alternative Medicine" in the Netherlands](https://sciencebasedmedicine.org/adverse-events-linked-to-pediatric-alternative-medicine-in-the-netherlands/) A study out of the Netherlands documented pediatric adverse events associated with complementary and alternative medicine over three years. Thankfully there weren't a lot of kids harmed, but when there is no potential benefit from an intervention, even one is way too many.
